entities.description: large language models are models whose performance is boosted for question answering tasks
retrieval augmented generation is a method to improve llm performance by querying relevant information from external documents
bookrag is a novel rag approach designed for documents with a hierarchical structure
bookindex is a novel index structure built by extracting a hierarchical tree from a document
information foraging theory is a theory that inspires the agent based query method in bookrag
the question answering task is the performance target for llms that rag methods aim to boost
a hierarchical structure is a property of many real world documents that organizes content at different granularity levels
an agent based query method is proposed in bookrag  inspired by information foraging theory
retrieval recall is a metric on which bookrag s performance is evaluated
qa accuracy is a metric on which bookrag s performance is evaluated

relations.description: rag is a method used to boost the performance of llms on the qa task
bookrag is introduced as a novel rag approach targeted for hierarchically structured documents
bookrag leverages the bookindex  a novel index structure  for its operation
bookrag is specifically targeted for documents with a hierarchical structure
bookrag proposes an agent based query method as part of its approach
the agent based query method is inspired by the information foraging theory
bookrag s performance is demonstrated by achieving state of the art results in retrieval recall
bookrag s performance is demonstrated by achieving state of the art results in qa accuracy
